name: ATW Dark Theme
description: i enjoy browsing all things weezer dot internet at night in the dark, but i like not searing my eyeballs even more
additional_info:
version 2.00a
----------------
removed full-width mode. width now clamps at a slightly higher value than the default forum.

version 2.00
----------------
site will now fill the width of your browser (please let me know if this sucks for you)
century gothic is now used throughout the theme for many UI elements
- note, posts and thread lists still use open sans for readability
- theme will fall back to open sans if century gothic is not present
tweaks to a number of elements to create a more rounded look
aesthetic tweaks to profile pages
misc. bugfixes


version 1.21
----------------
certain headers now use century gothic if available for extra weezer-y flair
reduced brightness of certain thread prefixes
made certain colors more consistent across the theme
bugfixes here and there

version 1.2
----------------
significantly reduced some areas of bright color in the theme like forum headers
several bug fixes including
- locked thread notifications
- "you are ignoring content by this member" notifications
- tab highlights on profile pages
- probably some other stuff i don't remember

version 1.15
----------------

fixed an issue with poll option highlight colors
added a dark theme for tags on threads
added a dark quick reply toolbar theme
misc fixes

version 1.1b
----------------

fixed display of post arrows on firefox

version 1.1a
----------------

fixed display of [spoiler] and [code] tags
adjusted post ratings box

version 1.1
----------------

fixed alert notifications being highlighted incorrectly
adjusted colors for "you have X new alerts" popup
adjust the username autocomplete dialog to match the theme
misc fixes

version 1.01
----------------

updated post rating list box to match the theme

version 1.0
----------------

initial release.
arrows on posts are bugged in firefox. i could probably fix it at some point but not right now
